verses.text: Moreover he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* an \w altar|strong="H4196"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*, \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* the \w length|strong="H0753"\w* thereof, and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* the \w breadth|strong="H7341"\w* thereof, and \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* the \w height|strong="H6967"\w* thereof.

¶ Also he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* a \w molten|strong="H3332"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* of \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* from \w brim|strong="H8193"\w* to \w brim|strong="H8193"\w*, \w round|strong="H5696"\w* in \w compass|strong="H5439"\w*, and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* the \w height|strong="H6967"\w* thereof; and a \w line|strong="H6957"\w* of \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* did \w compass|strong="H5437"\w* it round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*.\f + \fr 4.2 \ft from…: Heb. from his brim to his brim\f*

And under it \add was\add* the \w similitude|strong="H1823"\w* of \w oxen|strong="H1241"\w*, which did \w compass|strong="H5437"\w* it round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*: \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* in a \w cubit|strong="H0520"\w*, \w compassing|strong="H5362"\w* the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w*. \w Two|strong="H8147"\w* \w rows|strong="H2905"\w* of \w oxen|strong="H1241"\w* \add were\add* \w cast|strong="H3332"\w*, when it was \w cast|strong="H4166"\w*.

It \w stood|strong="H5975"\w* upon \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w* \w oxen|strong="H1241"\w*, \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w looking|strong="H6437"\w* toward the \w north|strong="H6828"\w*, and \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w looking|strong="H6437"\w* toward the \w west|strong="H3220"\w*, and \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w looking|strong="H6437"\w* toward the \w south|strong="H5045"\w*, and \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w looking|strong="H6437"\w* toward the \w east|strong="H4217"\w*: and the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \add was set\add* \w above|strong="H4605"\w* upon them, and all their hinder \w parts|strong="H0268"\w* \add were\add* \w inward|strong="H1004"\w*.

And the \w thickness|strong="H5672"\w* of it \add was\add* an \w handbreadth|strong="H2947"\w*, and the \w brim|strong="H8193"\w* of it like the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of the \w brim|strong="H8193"\w* of a \w cup|strong="H3563"\w*, with \w flowers|strong="H6525"\w* of \w lilies|strong="H7799"\w*; \add and\add* it \w received|strong="H2388"\w* and \w held|strong="H3557"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w baths|strong="H1324"\w*.\f + \fr 4.5 \ft with flowers…: or, like a lilyflower\f*

¶ He \w made|strong="H6213"\w* also \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w lavers|strong="H3595"\w*, and \w put|strong="H5414"\w* \w five|strong="H2568"\w* on the right \w hand|strong="H3225"\w*, and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* on the \w left|strong="H8040"\w*, to \w wash|strong="H7364"\w* in them: such things as they \w offered|strong="H4639"\w* for the burnt \w offering|strong="H5930"\w* they \w washed|strong="H1740"\w* in them; but the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \add was\add* for the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w* to wash \w in|strong="H7364"\w*.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft such…: Heb. the work of burnt offering\f*

And he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w candlesticks|strong="H4501"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* according to their \w form|strong="H4941"\w*, and \w set|strong="H5414"\w* \add them\add* in the \w temple|strong="H1964"\w*, \w five|strong="H2568"\w* on the right \w hand|strong="H3225"\w*, and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* on the \w left|strong="H8040"\w*.

He \w made|strong="H6213"\w* also \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w tables|strong="H7979"\w*, and \w placed|strong="H3240"\w* \add them\add* in the \w temple|strong="H1964"\w*, \w five|strong="H2568"\w* on the right \w side|strong="H3225"\w*, and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* on the \w left|strong="H8040"\w*. And he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w basons|strong="H4219"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*.\f + \fr 4.8 \ft basons: or, bowls\f*

¶ Furthermore he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* the \w court|strong="H2691"\w* of the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*, and the \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w court|strong="H5835"\w*, and \w doors|strong="H1817"\w* for the \w court|strong="H5835"\w*, and \w overlaid|strong="H6823"\w* the \w doors|strong="H1817"\w* of them with \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*.

And he \w set|strong="H5414"\w* the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* on the \w right|strong="H3233"\w* \w side|strong="H3802"\w* of the east \w end|strong="H6924"\w*, over \w against|strong="H4136"\w* the \w south|strong="H5045"\w*.

And \w Huram|strong="H2361"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* the \w pots|strong="H5518"\w*, and the \w shovels|strong="H3257"\w*, and the \w basons|strong="H4219"\w*. And \w Huram|strong="H2361"\w* \w finished|strong="H3615"\w* the \w work|strong="H4399"\w* that he was to \w make|strong="H6213"\w* for \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* for the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*;\f + \fr 4.11 \ft basons: or, bowls\f*\f + \fr 4.11 \ft finished: Heb. finished to make\f*

\add To wit\add*, the \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*, and the \w pommels|strong="H1543"\w*, and the \w chapiters|strong="H3805"\w* \add which were\add* on the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* of the two \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*, and the \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w wreaths|strong="H7639"\w* to \w cover|strong="H3680"\w* the \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w pommels|strong="H1543"\w* of the \w chapiters|strong="H3805"\w* which \add were\add* on the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* of the \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*;

And \w four|strong="H0702"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w* on the \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w wreaths|strong="H7639"\w*; \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w rows|strong="H2905"\w* of \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w* on \w each|strong="H0259"\w* \w wreath|strong="H7639"\w*, to \w cover|strong="H3680"\w* the \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w pommels|strong="H1543"\w* of the \w chapiters|strong="H3805"\w* which \add were\add* \w upon|strong="H6440"\w* the \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*.\f + \fr 4.13 \ft upon: Heb. upon the face of\f*

He \w made|strong="H6213"\w* also \w bases|strong="H4350"\w*, and \w lavers|strong="H3595"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* he upon the \w bases|strong="H4350"\w*;\f + \fr 4.14 \ft lavers: or, caldrons\f*
\w One|strong="H0259"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, and \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w* \w oxen|strong="H1241"\w* under it.

The \w pots|strong="H5518"\w* also, and the \w shovels|strong="H3257"\w*, and the \w fleshhooks|strong="H4207"\w*, and all their \w instruments|strong="H3627"\w*, did \w Huram|strong="H2361"\w* his \w father|strong="H0001"\w* \w make|strong="H6213"\w* to \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* for the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w bright|strong="H4838"\w* \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*.\f + \fr 4.16 \ft bright: Heb. made bright, or, scoured\f*

In the \w plain|strong="H3603"\w* of \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w* did the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w cast|strong="H3332"\w* them, in the \w clay|strong="H5645"\w* \w ground|strong="H0127"\w* between \w Succoth|strong="H5523"\w* and \w Zeredathah|strong="H6868"\w*.\f + \fr 4.17 \ft clay…: Heb. thicknesses of the ground\f*

Thus \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* all these \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* in \w great|strong="H3966"\w* \w abundance|strong="H7230"\w*: for the \w weight|strong="H4948"\w* of the \w brass|strong="H5178"\w* could not be found \w out|strong="H2713"\w*.

¶ And \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* all the \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* that \add were for\add* the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, the \w golden|strong="H2091"\w* \w altar|strong="H4196"\w* also, and the \w tables|strong="H7979"\w* whereon the \w shewbread|strong="H3899"\w* \add was set;\add*

Moreover the \w candlesticks|strong="H4501"\w* with their \w lamps|strong="H5216"\w*, that they should \w burn|strong="H1197"\w* after the \w manner|strong="H4941"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w oracle|strong="H1687"\w*, of \w pure|strong="H5462"\w* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*;

And the \w flowers|strong="H6525"\w*, and the \w lamps|strong="H5216"\w*, and the \w tongs|strong="H4457"\w*, \add made he of\add* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, \add and\add* that \w perfect|strong="H4357"\w* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*;\f + \fr 4.21 \ft perfect…: Heb. perfections of gold\f*

And the \w snuffers|strong="H4212"\w*, and the \w basons|strong="H4219"\w*, and the \w spoons|strong="H3709"\w*, and the \w censers|strong="H4289"\w*, \add of\add* \w pure|strong="H5462"\w* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*: and the \w entry|strong="H6607"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, the \w inner|strong="H6442"\w* \w doors|strong="H1817"\w* thereof for the \w most|strong="H6944"\w* \w holy|strong="H6944"\w* \add place\add*, and the \w doors|strong="H1817"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \w temple|strong="H1964"\w*, \add were of\add* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*.\f + \fr 4.22 \ft basons: or, bowls\f*
